description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Award_ScheduleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Award_ScheduleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Award_ScheduleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Award Schedule for update purposes only.

Award_Schedule_Data.description: Award Schedule Reference ID. This is the Award Schedule Unique Identifier.

Award_Posting_Interval_GroupObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Award_Posting_Interval_GroupObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Award_Posting_Interval_GroupObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Award_Schedule_Data.description: A reference to the Award Posting Interval Group for the Award Schedule.  The Award Posting Interval Group indicates the interval information (periods per year) for the Award Schedule.

Award_Year_Data.description: Award Period Reference ID. This is the Award Period unique identifier.

Award_Posting_IntervalObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Award_Posting_IntervalObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Award_Posting_IntervalObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Award_Period_Data.description: The award posting interval for the award period. This information is for outbound purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.
The Award Positing Interval Reference Id for the Award Period

Award_Posting_Interval_NameObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Award_Posting_Interval_NameObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Award_Posting_Interval_NameObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Award_Period_Data.description: A Reference to the Award Posting Interval Name for the Award Period.  Award Posting Interval Names are defined by the Award Posting Interval Group for the Award Schedule.

validation.validation: Enter a Posting Interval that is after the previous posting interval. The interval [current] isn't after the interval [previous].

Award_Period_Data.description: The Start Date of Award Interval
The End Date of Award Interval

validation.validation: Enter a Start Date that is before the end date.
There cannot be any gaps between Award Intervals.

Award_Year_Data.description: The Award Period End Date is Award Contract End Date.
The Award Period Start Date is Award Contract Start Date.

Award_Schedule_Data.description: Encapsulating element for information describing an Award Period

validation.validation: Enter a Period Name that isn't already in use.
Enter an Award Period Number that isn't already in use.
Award Period must contain all the Posting Interval Names from the Award Posting Interval Group.

description: Award Schedule Data for the single award schedule being created or updated.

validation.validation: Select only one Contract Start Date and one Contract End Date.
Enter a Contract Start Date that is before the Contract End Date.
